articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: If successful, the planned phased ceasefire could halt fighting that has left much of Gaza in ruins, displaced most of the enclave's pre-war population of 2.3 million, killed tens of thousands of people, and ease tensions across the wider Middle East.
articles.title: Negotiators appear close to sealing Gaza ceasefire deal

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Advisers to President-elect Donald Trump now concede that the Ukraine war will take months or even longer to resolve, a sharp reality check on his biggest foreign policy promise - to strike a peace deal on his first day in the White House.
articles.title: Trump advisers concede Ukraine peace deal is months away

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: A long-sought Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal emerged at the end of an intense 96 hours of negotiations in Doha brokered by U.S., Egyptian and Qatari diplomats who persuaded Israel and Hamas finally to conclude the agreement.
articles.title: Gaza deal emerged after intense 96 hours, US officials say

articles.author: Lisa Richwine
articles.description: Members of the St. Helena Fire Department have battled devastating fires in Northern California. Last Thursday, they rolled into Los Angeles at 2 a.m. to assist in the southern part of the state.
articles.title: Hundreds of firefighters 'just get up and go' to aid Los Angeles

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan described the Middle East in late September 2023 as "quieter" than it had been in two decades.
articles.title: Biden to hand unfinished agenda to Trump for chaotic Mideast

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Simon Lewis, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Aides to President-elect Donald Trump have asked three senior career diplomats who oversee the U.S. State Department's workforce and internal coordination to step down from their roles, two U.S. officials familiar with the matter said, in a possible signal of deeper changes ahead for the diplomatic corps.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trump team asks three US senior career diplomats to resign, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's anti-corruption agency will resume questioning impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol at 2 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Thursday afternoon, the Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea's anti-corruption agency to resume questioning Yoon on Thursday afternoon, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Bhargav Acharya
articles.description: A total of 78 bodies and 166 survivors - some of them emaciated and disorientated - have been hauled out so far in a court-ordered rescue operation, with hundreds more men still stuck 2 km (1.5 miles) below the surface in a gold mine at Stilfontein, southwest of Johannesburg.
articles.title: South Africa accused of 'horrific' crackdown as 78 corpses pulled from besieged mine

articles.author: Padraic Halpin, Conor Humphries
articles.description: Ireland's two major centre-right parties finalised a coalition deal with independent lawmakers on Wednesday that will return Micheal Martin as prime minister and continue the previous government's high spending economic policy.
articles.title: Irish parties pledge increased investment after coalition deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Venezuela inflation was 48% annually in 2024, the lowest in 12 years, Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro told lawmakers in an annual address to the national assembly and other officials on Wednesday, just days after he was inaugurated for a third term.
articles.title: Venezuela inflation was 48% year-on-year in 2024, Maduro tells lawmakers
